6.heading: Detaching.

12.heading: "A Detail Overlooked" (Gasoline Alley, Dec. 29, 1919) / King.
notes: Summary: Walt has plenty of antifreeze in his radiator and doesn't have to worry about the cold, but he left the flap down and the engine overheats.

notes: Summary: Burl is always detailing their car, a Geo Storm.

16.heading: Details.
16.title: "For Once He'll Skip the Details"
16.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: At the poker game, the Owls want to know how his slippers wager with the boarders came out; he won but he's been so busy with research he tends to forget about minor diversions.

17.heading: Details.
17.title: "I Try Not To Clutter My Mind With Unnecessary Details"
17.author: by Greg Howard and Craig MacIntosh.
notes: Key words: Baseball statistics, batting averages, memory, cooking.

18.heading: Details.
18.title: "I Wish He Wouldn't Make Dates While He's Mowing"
18.author: Mort, Greg & Brian Walker.
notes: Summary: Beetle shouts a new detail into Ms Buxley's window each time the lawnmowing brings him around.

20.heading: Details.
20.title: "It's Because He Didn't Count One Hole"
20.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood brags that he knocked eight strokes off his average; Herb fills in the details.

21.heading: Details.
21.title: "Thanks for Sparing Me the Details!"
21.author: O
notes: Summary: Cliff's back from the computer show and knows how to fix their computer, but is not talkative.

31.heading: Detection.
31.title: The Knowhow Book of Detection
31.author: Judy Hindley and Donald Rumbelow ; illustrated by Colin King.

Educational comic introduces the basic elements of crime detection, including searching for fingerprints, interviewing witnesses, using clues, collecting evidence, and international cooperation.
